It is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves, which distinguish it from other varieties in the genus. Native to specific regions in Madagascar, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with a pale pink to white coloration. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanically significant and endangered species.
